column4: Business jets risk U.S. pilot shortage on  competition from airlines
column5: MONTREAL  Nov 17 Business jet operators  already offering double digit raises to attract pilots  could face a labor shortfall in North America as they compete with U.S. airlines for talent  executives and analysts said.

column4: China Citic  Baidu launch direct bank in fintech push
column5: BEIJING China Citic Bank Corp  and search engine giant Baidu Inc  launched on Saturday a direct banking joint venture  dubbed AiBank  to capitalize on China's rapidly growing fintech sector.

column4: China Citic  Baidu launch direct bank in fintech push
column5: BEIJING  Nov 18 China Citic Bank Corp and search engine giant Baidu Inc launched on Saturday a direct banking joint venture  dubbed AiBank  to capitalise on China's rapidly growing fintech sector.

column4: Ex-Insys employee's lawyer does not need disqualified from bribe case: judge
column5: A federal magistrate judge has ruled that a lawyer's previous representations of other Insys Therapeutics Inc employees does not warrant his disqualification from defending a former Insys regional sales director against charges she engaged in a scheme to bribe doctors to prescribe an opioid.

column4: Exclusive: Qualcomm set to win conditional Japanese antitrust okay for NXP deal - source
column5: BRUSSELS U.S. smartphone chipmaker Qualcomm  is set to win “imminent” Japanese antitrust clearance for its $38-billion bid for NXP Semiconductors  and gain Europe’s approval by the end of the year with slight tweaks to its concessions  a person familiar with the matter said.

column4: Exclusive: Qualcomm set to win conditional Japanese antitrust okay for NXP deal - source
column5: BRUSSELS U.S. smartphone chipmaker Qualcomm  is set to win “imminent” Japanese antitrust clearance for its $38-billion bid for NXP Semiconductors  and gain Europe’s approval by the end of the year with slight tweaks to its concessions  a person familiar with the matter said.

column4: Spain's Gas Natural sells Colombian distribution unit to Brookfield
column5: MADRID  Nov 18 Spain's Gas Natural said late on Friday it had agreed to sell the 59.1 percent stake it owns in its Colombian retail distribution unit to infrastructures fund Brookfield Infrastructure for 482 million euros ($568 million.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. rejects Ford petition to delay recall of 3 million vehicles
column5: WASHINGTON  Nov 17 The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday it was rejecting a petition by Ford Motor Co to delay recalling about 3 million vehicles with potentially defective air bag inflators to conduct additional testing.

column4: Peru's Graña y Montero eyes mining projects  to cooperate in Odebrecht probe
column5: LIMA Peru's largest construction company  Graña y Montero  is hoping to win major mine contracts to replace lost business  its chairman said on Friday  as it seeks to minimize the fallout from its links with Brazil's scandal-plagued builder Odebrecht.

column4: UPDATE 1-Peru's Graña y Montero eyes mining projects  to cooperate in Odebrecht probe

column4: Pro-trade Republicans get nervous that NAFTA talks could fail
column5: MEXICO CITY Pro-trade Republicans in the U.S. Congress are growing worried that U.S. President Donald Trump may try to quit the NAFTA free trade deal entirely rather than negotiate a compromise that preserves its core benefits.

column4: Pro-trade U.S. Republicans get nervous that NAFTA talks could fail
column5: MEXICO CITY  Nov 17 Pro-trade Republicans in the U.S. Congress are growing worried that U.S. President Donald Trump may try to quit the NAFTA free trade deal entirely rather than negotiate a compromise that preserves its core benefits.

column4: Appeals court upholds Honeywell refrigerant patents challenged by Mexichem
column5: A federal appeals court on Friday upheld the validity of Honeywell International Inc patents on chemical refrigerant technology that had been challenged by Mexican industrial group Mexichem.

column4: Keystone pipeline spill pushes oil higher  fuels TransCanada opponents
column5: CALGARY  Alberta/LINCOLN  Neb. A major oil spill on the Keystone pipeline in South Dakota helped push U.S. crude prices higher on Friday  while fueling opposition to another pipeline project by owner TransCanada Corp that faces a crunch decision in Nebraska next week.

column4: Verizon close to announcing digital streaming deal with NFL: Bloomberg
column5: Verizon Communications Inc  no. 1 U.S. wireless carrier  is close to a new deal with the National Football League for digital streaming rights  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.
